title.narrative: IYCN: PREVENT MALNUTRITION AMONGST GIRLS AND BOYS UNDER 2 YEARS

description.narrative: Government and other partners have increased capacity to deliver services and bring about behavior change in infant and young child nutrition (IYCN) to prevent undernutrition amongst girls and boys.,which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Supply And Logistics, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: NUTRITION Outcome: Improved coverage and increased utilization of quality and equitable nutrition services for under five children, adolescent girls and mothers in most deprived provinces and areas.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
CO/RO Supply - technical assistance and collaboration in supply chain, procurement of goods and services, and logistics
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Afghanistan (Adolescent Health and Development)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015-2021 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Afghanistan 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Afghanistan 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Afghanistan 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and other partners have increased capacity to deliver services and bring about behavior change in infant and young child nutrition (IYCN) to prevent undernutrition amongst girls and boys.

description.narrative: Children continue to receive growth monitoring services with their caregivers counselled on infant feeding through a community promotive approaches, as a result of the Community-Based Nutrition Package (CBNP) and adaptations. Children 6-59 months were reached with Vitamin A supplementation to prevent deficiency and consequences of limiting healthy growth and development. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/07/2020

title.narrative: Number of sectors that integrated nutrition in thier program [Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH), Heakth Mobile Teams, Education, Polio]
Number/proportion of service delivery points (health posts/commuity) using CBNP tool kits providing IYCF counselling, support and communication
Number and proportion of fixed and mobile service delivery points with a trained nutrition counselor delivering services
Number of children who receive Vitamin A during National Immunisation Days (polio platform)
ECD internal strategy & action plan in place

actual.value: 2020:First draft of ECD strategy has been produced

title.narrative: Availability of a national ECD policy or implementation plan for scale-up
